results.title: Paysages du Silence (Silent Landscapes)
results.brief_description: Made in 1947, SILENT LANDSCAPES / PAYSAGES DU SILENCE is one of the earliest films made by Jacques Cousteau. The film was shot at a depth of up to 60 meters depth in the Mediterranean sea. This version is entirely silent, but the theatrical release version has an accompanying soundtrack.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

results.title: Paying for the past [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Nicola Woolmington, Penny Robins, SBS Independent, Film Victoria and Annamax Media
results.brief_description: An intriguing documentary which follows the story of a group of lawyers from Germany, United States and Australia who are in the process of negotiating the biggest class action the world has ever seen. Acting on behalf of Holocaust survivors who were either used as forced labour or slave labour for the German industrialists such as Siemens, BMW and Krupp, during World War II, these lawyers are seeking to put closure on Germany’s dark past through financial compensation, and emotional and moral reparation. Forced and slave labourers worked under the most horrendous conditions and came from the concentration camps, consisting of gypsies, homosexuals and Jews. BMW had upto 20,000 slave labourers by 1944, many who did not survive. Whereas forced labourers were never intended to be killed off, slave labourers were part of a German “destruction through work” policy, for example, at Krupp’s, eight out of ten slave labourers died. Australia, with the highest Holocaust survivor population after Israel, has over 3000 claimants with Henry Burstyner, a tenacious and unrelenting Melbourne lawyer, representing Australia in the class action. Includes personal narratives from Kitia Altman, Abraham Biderman and Erica Turek, Holocaust survivors in Melbourne and Sydney, along with family photographs, stills and archival footage and appearances by Karen Heilig (Claims Conference, NY), Kenneth McCallion (Goodkind Firm), Dr Michael Witti (Germany), Ed Fagan (Fagan & D’Avino, US) and Henry Burstyner in their negotiations with the German companies - their aim: settlement by the end of the millenium. Narrated by Robert Menzies.

results.title: Payback
results.creator_credit: Penny McDonald, Warwick Thornton and Blackfella Films
results.brief_description: Paddy, an old aboriginal man, has been in jail for twenty years. It is the day of his release. Paddy knows of two laws - white law and black law. The twenty years he has spent doing time for the white man’s law has been in preparation for this one - his payback day.

results.title: Pay the piper
results.brief_description: A boy and a girl are killed on the eve of their graduation from high school. Anger takes the place of sorrow when their parents discover that alcohol was involved in the accident report. The film comes to a dramatic climax as the father realizes that it was liquor from his own home that killed his daughter and her companion.

results.title: Pay off in pain
results.brief_description: The personal and social tragedy of drug addiction with its evil accompaniment, drug traffic. Over the side of the silent liner in the darkness slips the package of smuggled narcotics, introducing us to the complex problem which involves all races and classes of man. We see many aspects of addiction - the addict prepearing an injection, a group waiting tensely for their dope peddler; agents preparing and adulterating the illegal product; the police catching a pedler red-handed. International and national authorities are working from two angles - suppression of the illicit traffic; and where possible, rehabilitation of the addict.

results.title: Pay for performance
results.brief_description: Summary: Saul Gellerman and Emanuel Kay discuss how to avoid negative effects of poorly understood pay policies, how to ensure maximum advantage from salaries and wages and goal setting as a replacement for traditional performance appraisal programs
results.description: Summary: Saul Gellerman and Emanuel Kay discuss how to avoid negative effects of poorly understood pay policies, how to ensure maximum advantage from salaries and wages and goal setting as a replacement for traditional performance appraisal programs

results.title: Pay as you go
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the new Pay As You Go (PAYG) system, introduced with the Goods and Services Tax. It includes information on PAYG withholding and PAYG instalments and the requirements for business. Presented by Michael Caton.

results.title: Paws
results.creator_credit: Karl Zwicky, Vicki Watson, Andrena Finlay, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Latent Image Productions, AFFC and PolyGram Film International
results.brief_description: Zac (Nathan Cavaleri) never wanted a dog, until he met a special dog called PC. PC’s master, Alex, is murdered by the evil associates of his ex wife, Anja. Anja and Alex used to live in Iceland where Alex wrote computer programs; the only problem was that Anja stole her husband’s programs and sold them. Alex managed to escape to Australia with 1 million dollars and PC. Before his death Alex attaches a computer disc to PC’s collar and sends him off to a friend. PC ends up in the care of her neighbour, Zac. Through the assistance of a computer which translates dog noises into a human voice, Zac and PC become quickly become friends as they try and avoid Anja and find the 1 million dollars before her. Also starring Norman Kaye, Sandy Gore, Caroline Gillmer, Emilie Francois and Billy Connolly as the voice of PC.

results.title: Pavor nocturnus
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An abstract narrative about dream flashbacks of a disturbing nature. A child survives a car accident in which his father was killed. He has contiinuing mental flashbacks and consequently this makes him fear death. He is bitten on the arm by a fly, and this begins a surreal experience of messages being relayed to him via the fly bites. A surreal thriller where confusion between the dream self and the real self is explored.

results.title: Pavlovsk
results.brief_description: A picturesque film that looks at the beautiful Pavlovsk House. There is very little narration in this film but it is accompanied with music by 18th and 19th century composers and performances by members of the Leningrad Ballet Theatre.
